thread.title: Southern Lehigh field hockey team holds off Catasauqua
thread.title_full: Southern Lehigh field hockey team holds off Catasauqua

title: Southern Lehigh field hockey team holds off Catasauqua
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Southern Lehigh 1, Catasauqua 0 -- Rapid recap 
Southern Lehigh High School's field hockey team faced one of its most difficult challenges of the season Wednesday afternoon but held on for a 1-0 Colonial League victory over host Catasauqua . 
Turning point : Senior midfielder Paige Gehman got the ball rolling for the Spartans when she scored less than 13 minutes into the game on an assist from Allison Schroy . 
Top performers : Gehman gets the nod for Southern Lehigh for having the presence to score the game's only goal. Sophomore goalkeeper Hannah Greenburg was stellar in the cage for Catasauqua by stopping 17 shots and giving her team a fighting chance until the end. 
What it means : Southern Lehigh finishes an outstanding regular season in the league with just one loss, a 3-1 setback to Moravian Academy. The Spartans found the going tough but persevered to get the win. Catasauqua made an excellent showing and despite the loss, the solid effort should give the Rough Riders some confidence when they compete in the District 11 Class AA playoffs.
